DataElement.preferredName: Next Transplantation Or Cellular Therapy Infusion Procedure Same Disease Report Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not this report is for the next transplantation or cellular therapy infusion for the same disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Next Transplantation Or Cellular Therapy Infusion Procedure Same Disease Report
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Subsequent; immediately following in time or order._Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Utilization of specific cells, modified or not, for treatment of diseases. Donor lymphocyte infusion is a type of cellular therapy._A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream._Equal, or closely similar or comparable, in kind or quality or quantity or degree._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._A short textual account; having provided a short account.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Next Transplantation Or Cellular Therapy Infusion Procedure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Subsequent; immediately following in time or order.:Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Utilization of specific cells, modified or not, for treatment of diseases. Donor lymphocyte infusion is a type of cellular therapy.:A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream.

Concepts.definition: Subsequent; immediately following in time or order.
Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Utilization of specific cells, modified or not, for treatment of diseases. Donor lymphocyte infusion is a type of cellular therapy.
Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.

Property.preferredDefinition: Equal, or closely similar or comparable, in kind or quality or quantity or degree.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:A short textual account; having provided a short account.

Concepts.definition: Equal, or closely similar or comparable, in kind or quality or quantity or degree.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
A short textual account; having provided a short account.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Unk ND NA Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes, no, unknown, not done or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Unknown Not Done Not Applicable Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.:Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or completed.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.
Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
